DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study investigate whether topically apply constituent green tea [ caffeine ( - ) -epigallocatechin gallate ; EGCG ] protective effect skin expose ultraviolet light ( UV ) .
DOC.brief_title: Green Tea Ultraviolet Light-induced Skin Damage
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study investigate topically applied constituent green tea [ caffeine ( - ) - epigallocatechin gallate ; EGCG ] protective effect skin expose ultraviolet light ( UV ) . In double-blinded study subject receive 311 nanometer UVB light dose 0.5-1.5X individual minimal erythema dose ( MED ) . One part experiment involve apply topical natural product ( caffeine EGCG ) placebo bilateral symmetric site . The natural product placebo apply immediately 1/2 hour , 1 hour , 2 hour , 4 hour , 6 hour , 8 hour , 24 hour , 25 hour , 27 hour exposure 0.5-1.5 MED dose UV light . Another part study involve perform skin biopsy . One do prior UVB exposure , 2 do 24 hour 2 do 48 hour .
DOC.criteria: The subject normal adult volunteer 18 65 year age . Subjects drink two cup coffee , tea , caffeinated soda/beverages per day . Subjects unable get erythemic response ( i.e. , sunburn ) .
